intro: Galinsoga parviflora f. subeglandulosa, commonly known as the common beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family. It is characterized by its small, white to yellow flowers and hairy stems. The leaves are usually heart-shaped with serrated edges. This plant is native to the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It has a prostrate growth habit and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind.
